channel.title: Should I start with C or C++?
channel.description: Well, I'm really wondering which I should start with. I was thinking C at first but I've been told it has less libraries and that C++ is generally easier. Anyone want to suggest one?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @Tree_Climber Tree_Climber
item.description:
@Tree_Climber wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:18, topic:297530”]He said he has ‘basic knowledge’ of Java, which on this site usually means he has edited a private server, meaning he should start from scratch on the learning.

Bottom line it really doesn’t matter what language you start in, I just believe that learning OOP first might lead to better coding practices down the line.[/quote]
I’m a bit past that but not too much. I know a bit about proper design, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

He said he has ‘basic knowledge’ of Java, which on this site usually means he has edited a private server, meaning he should start from scratch on the learning.

Bottom line it really doesn’t matter what language you start in, I just believe that learning OOP first might lead to better coding practices down the line.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:297530”][quote author=Tree_Climber link=topic=393925.msg2928867#msg2928867 date=1251152809]
Cool, you guys have been a great help. I decided to start with C++.
[/quote]

I agree with lawl on this one. I would recommend you start with OOP programming with C++, and afterwards you can learn C if you want, which won’t be that different or hard for you.[/quote]the thing is, he’s already learned oop. he said he knows java. which means, he is in the perfect moment to learn C

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Tree_Climber:

Cool, you guys have been a great help. I decided to start with C++.

I agree with lawl on this one. I would recommend you start with OOP programming with C++, and afterwards you can learn C if you want, which won’t be that different or hard for you.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?

idk, i still havent started yet so.

item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:12, topic:297530”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=393925.msg2928751#msg2928751 date=1251150849]
i think the opposite; learning c++ first will scar you with bad habits in memory management

just as learning java first will blind you from the fact that there is a memory handling concept
[/quote]
not really. c++ abstracts a bit of memory handling away from you, makes it harder to fuck up, but still teaches you how to do it.[/quote]fucking up is what makes you strive to learn

@op: i really really recommend c, but since its ur choice at the end, feel free to learn c++ first then regret it

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

Cool, you guys have been a great help. I decided to start with C++.

item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:11, topic:297530”]i think the opposite; learning c++ first will scar you with bad habits in memory management

just as learning java first will blind you from the fact that there is a memory handling concept[/quote]
not really. c++ abstracts a bit of memory handling away from you, makes it harder to fuck up, but still teaches you how to do it.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

i think the opposite; learning c++ first will scar you with bad habits in memory management

just as learning java first will blind you from the fact that there is a memory handling concept

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:8, topic:297530”]@op: since C doesnt have any good ides, i would think that a shit one, like eclipse, would be the best one. although, ive seen problems with printf() actually directing output to eclipse’s stdout. i program C in notepad.

if you are willing to read a book, buy/download K&R’s “The C Programming Language” book; referred to as the c bible. other than that, id say programming with trial and error is the best way of learning

@lawl: if you learn C as your first language then oop is a new concept for you, which may lead to nasty habits. on the other hand, i learned java before c, and i dont have horrible habits. although, i should admit, when making big projects in C, i guarantee the code will be sloppy[/quote]
i learned java before c too, and i wasnt really talking about oop. theres more bad habits in memory management

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @Tree_Climber Tree_Climber
item.description:
@Tree_Climber wrote:

I have previous knowledge in Java(Basic knowledge).
And I’ll check out that book.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

@op: since C doesnt have any good ides, i would think that a shit one, like eclipse, would be the best one. although, ive seen problems with printf() actually directing output to eclipse’s stdout. i program C in notepad.

if you are willing to read a book, buy/download K&R’s “The C Programming Language” book; referred to as the c bible. other than that, id say programming with trial and error is the best way of learning

@lawl: if you learn C as your first language then oop is a new concept for you, which may lead to nasty habits. on the other hand, i learned java before c, and i dont have horrible habits. although, i should admit, when making big projects in C, i guarantee the code will be sloppy

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?

item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

the syntax would come along a bit easier than if you’d have started with a language like java, but memory handling is still somewhat abstract in c++, which means you’d still have to learn how to create proper, memory-efficient designs for your projects.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @Tree_Climber Tree_Climber
item.description:
@Tree_Climber wrote:

What if I started with C++ would learning C be like a whole other project?

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?

item.title: Should I start with C or C++?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

yes, C has less standard libraries, but enough for you to operate correctly. learning C is a good experience seeing as you learn so much about memory handling in general. not to mention the fact that C runs faster than c++, although the speed differences are barely notable.

once you’ve learned C, C++ will come naturally

so ya, C.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I start with C or C++?
